CatDescriptText: Mrs. Lloyd Brown, 2325 LaPlace Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 24, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you approve of women bartenders?" answer reads: "I approve of them. A lady should be able to tend a bar if she is guarded by a man.  Otherwise I disapprove."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Lloyd Brown, wearing button earrings, light colored ribbed jacket, and crocheted gloves, holding box, standing on Liberty Avenue with other pedestrians, and May Building in background, Downtown
